Medium: Watercolor and transferred printing ink on paper
Heilbrunn Timeline of Art History: Central Europe (Austria, Germany, and Switzerland), 1900 A.D.–present
Description: In this watercolor, Klee somewhat expanded the story of the creation of man. His Eve, after growing from Adam's rib, stays right there. She also remains a child. Evchen ("Little Eve") looks like a schoolgirl with flaxen hair tied in a braid. Adam is a broad-faced, grown man who sports earrings and a mustache. By placing the figures against a shallow ground with a reddish curtain, Klee seems to set the oddly matched pair on a puppet-theater stage.
